Best Essential Oils for a Detox Bath If you're trying to live a more natural lifestyle, you might be wondering about essential oils for detox. There are many health benefits associated with taking a relaxing detox bath with essential oil blends. How do I make an essential oil detox soak? Making a detox soak is simple. Start by filling your tub with warm water and adding between 10-15 drops of essential oils (or more depending on the size of your tub). You can also add a cup of Epsom salts and a few tablespoons of baking soda to help soften your skin. You can also add a carrier oil to the water to soften your skin. Here are a few options: - Olive oil - Coconut oil - Jojoba oil Other bath additives to draw toxins out include apple cider vinegar and bentonite clay. When to add essential oils to detox baths It is best to add your essential oils after you've filled the tub with warm water, but before you step in. This will ensure that the oils are evenly dispersed throughout the bath. How to prepare for your detox bath Before you start your detox bath, make sure to cleanse and exfoliate your skin first. This will help the essential oils absorb better into your body. You can also prepare a warm cup of herbal tea or lemon water to sip while enjoying your soak. Drink plenty of water before and after your relaxing bath. To boost the benefits of your detox bath, use your essential oil diffuser in the bathroom. Here are a few of my [favorite diffuser blends](https://confessionsofanover-workedmom.com/free-essential-oil-diffuser-blends/) you can make. What are the benefits of detox baths? Detox baths are a wonderful way to help your body naturally flush out toxins. They can also relax your muscles, relieve stress and tension, reduce inflammation, improve digestion, boost immunity and help clear up skin conditions. What can I put in my bath to detox? So, what essential oils help with detoxing? Here are some of the best oils for detox bath. - Lavender: Lavender essential oil is a great choice when it comes to detoxifying your body and mind. It can help reduce stress and anxiety, as well as promote better sleep. - Rosemary: Rosemary oil has anti-inflammatory properties that can help soothe sore muscles and joints after a workout or long day of work. - Peppermint: Peppermint oil is not only good for soothing an upset stomach, but it can also reduce fatigue and headaches. - Eucalyptus: This essential oil has a refreshing aroma that can help open your airways and clear out toxins from the lungs. - Lemon: Lemon essential oil helps to boost your immune system and increase energy levels. - Tea Tree: Tea tree oil is a great choice for fighting off bacteria and viruses, which can help give your body a natural detoxification boost. Detox bath blend ideas - Lavender & Eucalyptus: This blend is great for soothing sore muscles and calming the mind. - Rosemary & Lemon: This blend will help boost your energy levels while detoxifying your body. - Peppermint & Tea Tree: This combination of essential oils will help clear up skin issues and promote deep breathing. - Lavender & Rosemary: The perfect blend for reducing stress and tension while softening the skin. - Eucalyptus & Tea Tree: This blend of essential oils is great for fighting off bacteria and viruses, as well as improving respiratory health.
